attributes.action: Say NO to face masks at wedding receptions
attributes.additional_details: To allow couples to get married without having to postpone again, relieve some of the stress couples are experiencing, to enjoy there wedding day, to see there familys faces, not masks and for the happiest day of there lives to be happy.
attributes.background: To allow wedding ceremonies to go ahead without the need of facemasks/coverings as long as social distancing is in place.

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

rejection.details:
The Government's current guidance on weddings and receptions states that face coverings should form part of the mitigations in a wedding's risk assessment but does not require that these be worn: 
https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/covid-19-guidance-for-small-marriages-and-civil-partnerships/covid-19-guidance-for-small-marriages-and-civil-partnerships

Deciding whether to require face coverings as part of any booking is therefore a matter for individual venues.

You may be interested in this petition calling for a related action:

Don't make the wearing of face masks compulsory in public places in England: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/331174
